sub_work_functions.name: Manage employee communication
sub_work_functions.description: Creating an effective plan that initiates and promotes communication and engagement among the employees and between employees and management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop employee communication plan
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating a plan for managing communication among employees. Inform employees of direction. Counter resistance with change management approaches. Seek specific areas of input to the decision-making process. Seek varying degrees of involvement and co-creation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Conduct employee engagement surveys
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Questioning employees to ascertain overall workplace satisfaction.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Deliver employee communications
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Implementing the communication plan for employees. Initiate dialogues and engagement by monitoring the exchange of ideas and opinions, the development of personal relationships, etc.

work_functions.search_text: Develop and Manage Human Capital Delivering processes traditionally defined as "human resources". Process groups include those related to developing and maintaining workforce strategy, recruiting employees, developing and counseling employees, managing employee relations, rewarding and retaining employees, redeploying and retiring employees, managing employee information, and managing employee communications. Develop and manage human resources planning, policies, and strategies Creating strategies for the HR function. Create and implement strategies for managing the work force. Supervise and enhance the strategies, plans, and policies supporting the HR function. Developing models for managing competency levels of the HR of the organization. Develop human resources strategy Creating a long-term plan to associate human resource requirements with the strategic goals of the company to ensure that there is enough qualified staffing to achieve those goals, to maintain competitive advantage and to reduce employee turnover. Develop and implement workforce strategy and policies Creating and executing strategies and policies for smooth administration of work force. Determine and gather skill requirements. Plan the requirements for employee resourcing per unit. Create compensation, succession, HR program, and employee diversity plans. Develop and administer policies for HR. Develop benefits for employees. Create models for work force strategies. Monitor and update strategy, plans, and policies Supervising the HR strategy, plans, and policies in order to refurbish them whenever needed. Determine the performance of HR plans and policies by measuring the objective achievement rate and its contribution to the overall business strategy. Ensure that information about these plans and strategies is effectively communicated to various stakeholders. Incorporate any suggestions by these stakeholders when revising HR plans and policies. Develop competency management models Creating and implementing the tools for managing the competency levels of HR. Design a model for integrating HR planning with business planning. Assess current HR capacity based on the competencies against the capacity needed to achieve the vision, mission, and business goals of the organization. Consider factors such as employee development, career path, compensation policies, and performance management. Recruit, source, and select employees Determining and handling employee requirements. Recruit or source the candidates as per the requirements. Screen and select the most appropriate candidates. Take care of the newly hired and re-hired employees. Maintain records of information for all applicants. Manage employee requisitions Handling the requirements for new employees. Create and open job requisitions by clearly defining the job descriptions. Post these requirements internally and externally, and modify them as appropriate. Manage the dates of the whole requisition process. Recruit/Source candidates Recruiting new candidates for deployment across various functional areas inside the organization. Select methods for sourcing new employees. Manage relationships with third-party agencies. Stage recruitment fairs and drives. Manage employee referral programs. Screen and select candidates Evaluating and selecting potential employees through interviews, tests, etc. Manage new hire/re-hire Creating and making job offers to the selected candidates. Fairly negotiate the job offers. Agree on terms with the candidate to complete the hiring process. Manage applicant information Creating and maintaining a system for managing the information of applicants. Create records for all candidates who apply. Maintain and track information through the use applicant-tracking systems. Manage employee onboarding, training, and development Assisting employees in developing their capabilities, and providing them counseling services. Handle the orientation and deployment of the employees. Administer the performance of employees. Administer the development and enhancement of the employees. Provide training and development programs for employees. Manage employee orientation and deployment Creating and maintaining various employee on-boarding programs typically known as induction programs in order to ensure that the new employees are effectively introduced to the organization and its existing employees. Examine and evaluate the performance of these induction programs. Execute these programs on the ground level. Manage employee performance Defining individual performance objectives. Review performance in order to provide appraisals. Evaluate the efficiency and effectiveness of the current performance program. Update it regularly. Manage employee career development Establishing employee development guidelines. Lay out career paths and plans for them. Manage the development of their skills to enhance their skills, ability, and knowledge. Develop and train employees Creating a link between employee and organizational development needs. Conduct and manage employee training programs by considering the need and availability of these programs. Manage employee relations Assisting general management in developing, maintaining, and improving employee relationships. This is accomplished through communication, performance management, processing grievances, and/or dispute. Interpret and convey organizational policies. Manage labor relations Managing labor relations, the collective bargaining process, and the relationships between the labor and management. Take care of employee grievances. Manage collective bargaining process Managing any negotiations between an employer and a group of employees that determine the conditions of employment. Engage employees to reach agreements in regulating working conditions. Manage labor management partnerships Handling partnerships between labor and management. Develop a lasting two-way relationship that is beneficial for the labor, management, and the organization. Manage employee grievances Taking care or resolving any complaint raised by an employee by procedures provided for in a collective agreement, an employment contract, or by other mechanisms established by an employer. Monitor legal and regulatory environment Awareness of the employee legislature that is in place for the organization. The regulatory environment could include areas, regions, or countries. Reward and retain employees Creating frameworks for rewarding and recognizing employees with the objective of retaining them. Create and manage programs for provision of rewards, recognition, and motivation. Manage and administer the benefits for employees. Help assist and retain employees. Administer payroll to employees. Develop and manage reward, recognition, and motivation programs Developing a salary/compensation structure and plan; developing a benefits and reward plan; develop commission plan; performing competitive analyses of benefits and rewards; identifying compensation requirements based on compensation, benefits, and HR policies; administering compensation, commission, and rewards to employees; and rewarding and motivating employees. Manage and administer benefits Managing and ensuring benefits enrollment by the employees. Process any benefit claims made by the employees. Balance the estimated amount and entitled amount of benefits. Manage employee assistance and retention Managing activities centered around delivering programs to support work/life balance for employees; developing family support systems; reviewing retention and motivation indicators; and reviewing compensation plans. Administer payroll Managing the sum of all financial records of salaries for an employee, including wages, bonuses, and deductions. Use a payroll management system to deal with the financial aspects of employees' salaries, allowances, deductions, gross pay, net pay, etc. Generate pay slips for a specific period. Redeploy and retire employees Managing the reassignment and retirement of employees. Manage the process of employee promotion and demotion. Administer separation, retirement, and leaves of absence. Outplace employees. Deploy personnel. Relocate employees in order to manage assignments. Manage promotion and demotion process Administering the process of promoting and demoting employees. Design a system for advancing or demoting an employee's rank or position. Leverage techniques such as horizontal promotion, vertical promotion, dry promotion, and involuntary/voluntary demotion. Manage separation Managing the process of employee separation, including resignations, discharges, and layoffs. Inform the employee of the termination. Complete paperwork for continuation of benefits. Manage retirement Managing and administering instances where a person stops employment completely. Manage leave of absence Managing the period of time that an employee must be away from their primary job, while maintaining the status of employee (i.e., paid and unpaid leave of absence but not vacations, holidays, hiatuses, sabbaticals, and work-from-home programs). Develop and implement employee outplacement Helping former employees transition to new jobs or to re-orient themselves in the job market. Deliver help through one-on-one sessions or in a group format. Provide guidance in career evaluation, resume writing, interview preparation, developing networks, and job searching. Manage workforce scheduling Organizing the workforce so that all positions are covered for all shifts with the necessary skilled resources in place. work_functions.name: Manage Information Technology (IT)
work_functions.description: Managing process groups relevant to the business of information technology within an organization. The process groups include "Develop and manage IT customer relationships", "Develop and manage IT business strategy", " Develop and manage IT resilience and risk", " Manage information", " Develop and manage services/solutions", "Deploy services/solutions", and " Create and manage support services/solutions".

sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage IT customer relationships
sub_work_functions.description: Creating and administering relationships with IT customers. Understanding customer needs including high-level business requirements for IT transformation. Plan for and communicate IT services along with establishing IT service levels, providing transformation guidance, and performance analysis that foster IT customer relationships.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Understand IT customer needs
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Assessing the customer communities along with current IT operational capabilities and usage.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Identify IT customer transformation needs
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Identifying changing needs of staff dependent on information technology based on continuous improvement to deliver results according to organizational goals.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan and communicate IT services
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Create and design an organized and curated collection of all IT-related services that can be performed by, for, or within the organization. Maintain and convey information about deliverables, prices, contact points, and processes for requesting an information technology service.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Provide IT transformation guidance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Understanding the necessity of IT transformation for the business. Collect and analyze customer requirements. Identify opportunities and prioritize outcomes. Develop and support business case for transformation. Develop transformation plan and roadmap.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage IT service levels
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Establishing and maintaining service levels for the provision of IT services and solutions. Design and maintain the IT services and solution catalogue, as well as service level agreements. Evaluate the performance of IT service level agreements. Communicate the results to the management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage IT customer relationships
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing the IT relationship with its customers by systematically coordinating interactions over multiple touch points on a regular basis. Coordinate the IT's efforts to reach out to its customers, which include emails, social-media interactions, newsletters, and direct conversations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Analyze service performance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Proactively manage IT service levels against IT customer requirements.

sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage IT business strategy
sub_work_functions.description: Handling the business of IT. Create a organization-wide strategy for the IT function. Define the organization's IT architecture. Manage the IT portfolio. Research and innovate in the field of IT. Assess and convey the performance and the value of the IT function.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define business technology and governance strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Defining the need of technology in business and systematic implementation of IT investments. It comprises of assessing competitive technology components to ensure structural analysis, development, usage and security of technology for efficient business operations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage IT portfolio strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Strategy for systematic management of IT investments, projects, and activities. Analyze and examine the value of the IT portfolio and allocate resources based on business objectives.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and maintain enterprise architecture
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Outlining and maintaining the organization's IT architecture. Establish the IT architecture definition and framework. Ensure the relevance of IT. Create and confirm the approach for IT maintenance. Create rules and regulations to guide IT architecture. Authenticate and finalize all IT related research and innovation that takes place within the organization.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define IT service management strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Defining perspective, position, plans, and patterns needed to execute designing, delivering, managing, and improving the way information technology is used within an organization.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Control IT management system
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Regulating the IT management system through performance measures, governance, analysis, and monitoring through a variety of analytic tools. Evaluate IT finances, resource, services, projects, and value for report out.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage IT value portfolio
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and establishing the value portfolio. Defining, analyzing, and examining the value of projects, investments, and activities of the IT function.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and manage technology innovation
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Outline and manage the innovation of technology within the organization. Research and understand emerging future technological concepts and capabilities. Plan for IT innovation investments. Plan and execute viable innovation projects.

sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage IT resilience and risk
sub_work_functions.description: Develop and include the processes required to rapidly adapt and respond to any internal or external opportunity, demand, disruption, or threat to IT. Develop a more dynamic, strategic, and integrated approach to managing risk and compliance obligations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop IT compliance, risk, and security strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Ensuring that the organization effectively manages risk. Develop rules and standards for robust IT operations, manage risk, and adopt measures to protect integrity, confidentiality, and security of IT assets.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop IT resilience strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing resilience strategies of IT across the organization so that prospective risks can be avoided.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Control IT risk, compliance, and security
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Ensure effective control in overall IT risk management, formulate and execute guidelines in-line with regulatory bodies, and manage organizational security throughout the business operations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan and manage IT continuity
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Planning and managing IT's ability to recover from exposure to internal and external threats.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage IT security, privacy, and data protection
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and deploying an architecture for securing and ensuring the privacy of data flows throughout the organization. Create and develop protocols that ensure proper and efficient use of IT services and solutions

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Conduct and analyze IT compliance assessments
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Evaluate and analyze the IT environment for the compliance of industry regulations and government legislation. Ensure that IT capability and resources meet the set standards.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and execute IT resilience and continuity operations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Create and execute a process to rapidly adapt and respond to any internal or external opportunity, demand, disruption, or threat in IT. Maintain continuous IT operations to protect employees, assets, and overall brand equity.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage IT user identity and authorization
sub_sub_work_functions.description: The process of identifying, authenticating, and authorizing IT users to have access to applications, systems, IT components, or networks by associating user rights and restrictions with established identities.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage information
sub_work_functions.description: Creating strategies to manage the organization's information and content. Outline the architecture for information. Administer information resources. Administer the management of data and content.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define business information and analytics strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Create an organization-wide strategy for the IT function by combining skills, technologies, applications, and processes in order to attain organizations objectives.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and maintain business information architecture
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating strategies to manage the organization's information and content. Outline the architecture for information collection and communication. Administer information resources, data management and content.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and execute business information lifecycle planning and control
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Develop and implement strategies to plan and manage the flow of an information system's data from creation and initial storage to the time when it becomes obsolete and deleted.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage business information
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating strategies to administer information and content. Understand the needs of the organization for information and content management. Realize the role of IT services for implementing the overall business strategy. Assess the implications of new technologies for managing information and content. Identify and prioritize the most effective and efficient actions for managing information and content.

sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage services/solutions
sub_work_functions.description: Designing and maintaining the IT services/solutions catalogue. Evaluate the performance of IT services/solutions. Communicate the results to the management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop service/solution and integration strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing service/solution along with creating a strategy that provides a base for delivering service/solution aligned with overall business needs. Conduct research within the services/solutions field for development and integration.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage service/solution lifecycle planning
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Executing life-cycle planning for IT services and solutions. Develop new requirements and feature-function enhancements. Create and design a life cycle plan that addresses the current and future state of IT services and solutions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage service/solution architecture
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating the architecture for the IT services and solutions. Assess architecture and business constraints in order to understand integration requirements. Promote existing architecture. Manage exceptions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Execute IT service/solution creation and testing
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Understanding customer requirements. Design the IT services and solutions based on the requirements. Develop components for providing the requirements. Train resources to provide support. Test the IT services and solutions in advance. Confirm the customer experience post-sale.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform service/solution maintenance and testing
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Engaging in all aspects of service/solution maintenance and testing includes all preventative, routine, and corrective activates. Ensure that IT service/solution are functioning properly and regulations where applicable.

sub_work_functions.name: Deploy services/solutions
sub_work_functions.description: Executing IT services/solutions by creating a strategy for deployment. Plan and execute the changes. Plan and administer the release of its IT services and solutions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage service/solution deployment strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and implementing a strategy for the deployment of IT service/solution. Define all of the activities that make the IT function available for use. Establish the change policies for IT services and solutions. Define the deployment process, procedures, and tools. Select the most feasible and practical methodologies for the deployment process.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan service and solution implementation
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Strategizing and executing changes in IT solutions and services. Create a plan for deploying the changes. Communicate with stakeholders about the changes. Administer and implement the changes. Train the resources who will be affected by these changes. Install changes and verify their effect.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage change deployment control
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and deploying an architecture for securing the changes deployed in the organization. Create and develop protocols that ensure proper and efficient use of deployed IT services and solutions. Test, evaluate, and implement the policies and protocols.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Implement technology solutions
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Deploy the identified solutions for information technology important for healthy business operations. Confirm status and operational availability of IT resources. Perform testing and distribution of change. Execute roll-back protocol if necessary.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform service and solution rollout
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Strategizing and executing changes in IT solutions and services. Create a plan for deploying the changes. Communicate with stakeholders about the changes. Administer and implement the changes. Train the resources who will be affected by these changes. Install changes and verify their effect.

sub_work_functions.name: Create and manage support services/solutions
sub_work_functions.description: Establishing and managing services for providing support to users of IT services and solutions. Define the plethora of services by which the organization assists users of computers, software products, or other information technology products.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and establish service delivery strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Defining and establishing strategy for delivering IT services and solutions to the users. Design an IT service delivery model that defines the processes and procedures needed to deliver the IT services and solutions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define and develop service support strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Defining and creating a strategy for provision of support to users of IT services and solutions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan and manage service delivery control
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Determine and manage service delivery flow across different business functions. Understand the level of services needed by different stakeholders. Identify major service delivery touch points and criticality associated. Ensure timely communication with users.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage infrastructure resource planning
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing and managing the resources required for administration of infrastructure. Manage the IT inventory and assets to meet organization's IT resource capacity.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Define service support planning
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Develop strategies and methodologies to provide service support. Examine service levels, support complexity, stakeholder requirements to offer service support.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop and manage service delivery operations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing and managing different delivery services using service delivery systems for operational activities within the IT function in order to achieve organizations goal.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage infrastructure resource administration
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing the resources required for administration of IT infrastructure. Manage the IT inventory and assets. Take care of the organization's IT resource capacity.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Operate IT user support
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing systematic user support functionality and capability through defined procedures. Determine, record, and monitor user requests. Execute issue/request resolution. Utilize escalation path when needed. Resolve issue/request.

work_functions.name: Manage Financial Resources
work_functions.description: Overseeing key back-office processes for organizations. This category includes process groups related to planning and management accounting, revenue accounting, general accounting and reporting, fixed-asset project accounting, payroll, accounts payable and expense reimbursements, treasury operations, internal controls, tax management, international funds/consolidation, and global trade services.

sub_work_functions.name: Perform planning and management accounting
sub_work_functions.description: Determining different stages of the planning process and accounting. Classify, determine, analyze, interpret, and communicate information to make up-to-date business decisions for better management and control functions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform planning/budgeting/forecasting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Allocating funds to meet future and current financial goals. Led by the chief financial officer, have the finance function plan, budget, and forecast in order to determine and describe long and short-term financial goals.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform cost accounting and control
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Defining costs to be incurred and methods for optimum utilization. Determine the costs of products, processes, projects, etc. to compile in the financial statements, as well as to assist management in making decisions regarding planning and control. Control costs by managing and reducing business expenses.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform cost management
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Deciding which expenses can be avoided to reduce some costs and increase revenues. Plan and control the organization's budget to forecast future expenditures.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Evaluate and manage financial performance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Checking and achieving predetermined financial targets and timelines. Assess and manage the profitability, feasibility, and consistency of a business or project. Study the revenues generated.

sub_work_functions.name: Perform revenue accounting
sub_work_functions.description: Comparing revenue targets to reality. Review all transactions and entries passed in final accounts in a year in order to examine profits.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process customer credit
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Evaluating and processing requests for advances. Evaluate credit requests by customers requiring loans to buy products/services.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Invoice customer
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Preparing detailed reports of customer purchases. Prepare a commercial document between the seller and customer with details about transaction. Detail the quantity purchased, price of products/services, date, parties involved, unique invoice number, and tax information.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process accounts receivable (AR)
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Processing payments due from customers. This includes all processing of funds received, whether by check or electronically. This does not include the generation of invoices.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage and process collections
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Posting entries to respective accounts, and preparing accounts for receivables. Manage the cash collected by the business from its debtors. Record it in the books of accounts to provide clear information about the availability of the cash.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage and process adjustments/deductions
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and providing funds for necessary adjustments and deductions, including all expenses that were required for the business at certain point in time.

sub_work_functions.name: Perform general accounting and reporting
sub_work_functions.description: Making statements about business activities and functions. Prepare financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, statement of cash flows, and statement of stockholders' equity) according to accounting concepts and principles.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage financial policies and procedures
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating procedures to perform general accounting and reporting. Follow the rules and regulations made for a particular process in the business. Publish accounting policies.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform general accounting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Applying basic principles, concepts, and accounting practices in recording and preparing final accounts, and using accounting information in management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform fixed-asset accounting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Accounting for long-term and fixed assets. Record purchased, fixed assets that are not easily convertible into cash. Account for costs, useful life, resale value, depreciation, and amortization.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform financial reporting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Reporting on the organization's financial status to stakeholders. Include balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and statements of shareholders' equity.

Include balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and statements of shareholders' equity.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage fixed-asset project accounting
sub_work_functions.description: Managing accounts for large funds-invested projects. Manage and account for fixed assets projects (capital projects), which required significant capital investments over many years.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform capital planning and project approval
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Preparing a project finance report to solicit approvals in capital projects. Prepare budgets for projects that require heavy investments. Report on project finances to solicit approvals from management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform capital project accounting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Accounting for large-scale and large-cost investments. Manage and account for ongoing activities related to capital projects, including setting up new projects, recording project transactions, monitoring and tracking spending, closing and capitalizing projects, and measuring the financial returns on completed projects.

Manage and account for ongoing activities related to capital projects, including setting up new projects, recording project transactions, monitoring and tracking spending, closing and capitalizing projects, and measuring the financial returns on completed projects.

sub_work_functions.name: Process payroll
sub_work_functions.description: Handling reporting time, managing pay, and processing taxes from salaries. Pay employees. Withhold taxes. Confirm the correct funds are paid to the correct government agency.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Report time
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Recording the reporting time of employees on-site. Track working days, salary calculations, holidays taken, number of hours spend in the office, billing hours, etc.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage pay
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing the total payments made in employees payroll, including bonuses and compensation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage and process payroll taxes
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Deducting and paying taxes from employees' salaries.

Manage and process payroll taxes Deducting and paying taxes from employees' salaries.

sub_work_functions.name: Process accounts payable and expense reimbursements
sub_work_functions.description: Handling bills and reimbursements to be made. Make payments for goods or services taken or used on behalf of the organization.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process accounts payable (AP)
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Processing payments of operating expenses and other supplier charges. This includes the development of policies and procedures around processing of accounts payable and all operations. This process is often supported by key technology enablers.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process expense reimbursements
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Processing reimbursements to employees for the expenses incurred during the course of business. Approve and process advancements and reimbursements for employee expenses on the organization's behalf. Capture and report relevant tax data and manage personal accounts.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage corporate credit cards
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Handling and authoring credit cards to business entities or for corporate purchases.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage treasury operations
sub_work_functions.description: Managing business's investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Manage the financial assets and holdings of the organization. Optimize the organization's liquidity. Invest excess cash. Reduce financial risks.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage treasury policies and procedures
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing rules and regulations for investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Establish policies and procedures for investments made. Optimize liquidity in treasury operations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage cash
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Taking care of all cash-related activities in the business. Manage and reconcile cash positions. Manage cash equivalents. Process and oversee electronic fund transfers. Develop cash flow forecasts. Manage cash flows. Produce cash management accounting transactions and reports. Manage and oversee banking relationships. Analyze, negotiate, resolve, and confirm bank fees.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage in-house bank accounts
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing financial services provided by an in-house bank structure in the corporation that is operating like a commercial bank.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage debt and investment
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Taking care of the organization's financial position. Manage its loans or debts from different sources and investments. Leverage the most profitable options to balance the financial position in the market.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Monitor and execute risk and hedging transactions
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Performing transactions that limit investment risk with the help of derivatives, such as options and futures contracts. Manage interest rates, foreign exchange, and exposure risks. Develop and execute hedging transactions. Evaluate and refine hedging positions. Produce hedge accounting transactions and reports. Monitor credit.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage financial fraud/dispute cases
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Handling cases that involve financial fraud. Resolve disputes.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage internal controls
sub_work_functions.description: Administering internal controls. This process requires the organization to manage entity's board of trustees, management, and other personnel in order to offer judicious assurance about the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Establish internal controls, policies, and procedures
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Forming rules and regulations to ensure the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Operate controls and monitor compliance with internal controls policies and procedures
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Performing planning, management, operations, and monitoring of internal control mechanism policies and procedures in order to manage internal controls.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Report on internal controls compliance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Reporting on internal controls compliance to the appropriate authority, including IT regulations and pertinent data.

This process requires the organization to manage entity's board of trustees, management, and other personnel in order to offer judicious assurance about the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting. Establish internal controls, policies, and procedures Forming rules and regulations to ensure the achievement of effectiveness, proficiency of operations, and reliability of financial reporting. Operate controls and monitor compliance with internal controls policies and procedures Performing planning, management, operations, and monitoring of internal control mechanism policies and procedures in order to manage internal controls. Report on internal controls compliance Reporting on internal controls compliance to the appropriate authority, including IT regulations and pertinent data.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage taxes
sub_work_functions.description: Estimating the organization's periodic tax liabilities. Ensure that appropriate taxing authorities receive tax return filings and payments when due.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop tax strategy and plan
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Setting targets for periodic tax liabilities. Assess the tax impact of various activities such as the acquisition or disposal of fixed assets or a deliberate change in number of employee.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process taxes
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Processing the taxes of the organization in line with the regional taxation structure, including corporate, property, excise, and service taxes.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage taxes Estimating the organization's periodic tax liabilities. Ensure that appropriate taxing authorities receive tax return filings and payments when due. Develop tax strategy and plan Setting targets for periodic tax liabilities. Assess the tax impact of various activities such as the acquisition or disposal of fixed assets or a deliberate change in number of employee. Process taxes Processing the taxes of the organization in line with the regional taxation structure, including corporate, property, excise, and service taxes.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage international funds/consolidation
sub_work_functions.description: Managing cash collections and disbursements made by operating units across the enterprise. When appropriate, transfer cash from the operating units to parent-level bank accounts managed by the organization's treasury team.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Monitor international rates
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Forecasting and monitoring changes in foreign currency value or interest rates around the world that play an important role in the organization.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage transactions
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing any transfer of funds in the course of conducting cross-border trades or investments, including conversion across currencies. Find the most suitable alternative for making payments, while saving taxes and avoiding any unwarranted regulation, with the objective of protecting capital.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Monitor currency exposure/hedge currency
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Assessing exposure to potential financial losses as a result of changes in the value of currencies. Forecast the impact of movements in foreign currency values. Enter into financial transactions designed to offset or limit potential exposure to loss.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Report results
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Documenting and reporting accounting entries to formally report financial gains or losses experienced as a result of foreign exchange activity.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage international funds/consolidation Managing cash collections and disbursements made by operating units across the enterprise. When appropriate, transfer cash from the operating units to parent-level bank accounts managed by the organization's treasury team. Monitor currency exposure/hedge currency Assessing exposure to potential financial losses as a result of changes in the value of currencies. Forecast the impact of movements in foreign currency values. Enter into financial transactions designed to offset or limit potential exposure to loss. Report results Documenting and reporting accounting entries to formally report financial gains or losses experienced as a result of foreign exchange activity.

sub_work_functions.name: Perform global trade services
sub_work_functions.description: Making and collecting payments for transactions in products/services, and transporting them to interested markets.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Screen sanctioned party list
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Evaluating the approved list of parties for engaging in international trade in order to ensure the safety of the organization's business transactions. Examine agents that have been granted legal rights to engage in global trade and their credentials.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Control exports and imports
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Overseeing and directing the flow of trade to/from the organization in order to ensure financial gains.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Classify products
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Systematically categorizing products/services for their suitability to international trade. Create classes and categories for demarcating the types of products suitable for international trade. Study requisite national and international standards and the adherence of the organization's portfolio of offerings to these.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform currency conversion
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Identifying current exchange rates between two currencies and converting the foreign currency to that of the local monetary unit. I.E., yen to US dollar.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Calculate duty
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Computing the excise duty to be paid during international trade.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Communicate with customs
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Communicating with the customs department to ensure fluid compliance. Share pertinent information mandated by law with the government agency that controls and collects the duties levied for the international exchange of products/services.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Document trade
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Documenting and recording the trade processes while making transactions, noting the description, quality, number, transportation medium, indemnity, and inspection.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Process trade preferences
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Preparing global trade under preference, which allows the organization to import/export products at a lower or nil rate of customs duty and/or levy charge.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Handle restitution
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Administering and overseeing all restitution activities the organization may be subjected to. Manage compliance with apposite legal frameworks. Make any restitution that may be required by law; comply with authorities over any fines or non-financial measures imposed.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Prepare letter of credit
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating a document assuring that a seller will receive payment when certain delivery conditions are met. (If the buyer is unable to make payment on the purchase, a bank covers the outstanding amount.)

work_functions.search_text: Manage Financial Resources Overseeing key back-office processes for organizations. This category includes process groups related to planning and management accounting, revenue accounting, general accounting and reporting, fixed-asset project accounting, payroll, accounts payable and expense reimbursements, treasury operations, internal controls, tax management, international funds/consolidation, and global trade services. Perform planning and management accounting Determining different stages of the planning process and accounting. Classify, determine, analyze, interpret, and communicate information to make up-to-date business decisions for better management and control functions. Perform planning/budgeting/forecasting Allocating funds to meet future and current financial goals. Led by the chief financial officer, have the finance function plan, budget, and forecast in order to determine and describe long and short-term financial goals. Perform cost accounting and control Defining costs to be incurred and methods for optimum utilization. Determine the costs of products, processes, projects, etc. to compile in the financial statements, as well as to assist management in making decisions regarding planning and control. Control costs by managing and reducing business expenses. Perform cost management Deciding which expenses can be avoided to reduce some costs and increase revenues. Plan and control the organization's budget to forecast future expenditures. Evaluate and manage financial performance Checking and achieving predetermined financial targets and timelines. Assess and manage the profitability, feasibility, and consistency of a business or project. Study the revenues generated. Perform revenue accounting Comparing revenue targets to reality. Review all transactions and entries passed in final accounts in a year in order to examine profits. Process customer credit Evaluating and processing requests for advances. Evaluate credit requests by customers requiring loans to buy products/services. Invoice customer Preparing detailed reports of customer purchases. Prepare a commercial document between the seller and customer with details about transaction. Detail the quantity purchased, price of products/services, date, parties involved, unique invoice number, and tax information. Process accounts receivable (AR) Processing payments due from customers. This includes all processing of funds received, whether by check or electronically. This does not include the generation of invoices. Manage and process collections Posting entries to respective accounts, and preparing accounts for receivables. Manage the cash collected by the business from its debtors. Record it in the books of accounts to provide clear information about the availability of the cash. Manage and process adjustments/deductions Creating and providing funds for necessary adjustments and deductions, including all expenses that were required for the business at certain point in time. Perform general accounting and reporting Making statements about business activities and functions. Prepare financial statements (balance sheet, income statement, statement of cash flows, and statement of stockholders' equity) according to accounting concepts and principles. Manage financial policies and procedures Creating procedures to perform general accounting and reporting. Follow the rules and regulations made for a particular process in the business. Publish accounting policies. Perform general accounting Applying basic principles, concepts, and accounting practices in recording and preparing final accounts, and using accounting information in management. Perform fixed-asset accounting Accounting for long-term and fixed assets. Record purchased, fixed assets that are not easily convertible into cash. Account for costs, useful life, resale value, depreciation, and amortization. Perform financial reporting Reporting on the organization's financial status to stakeholders. Include balance sheets, income statements, cash flow statements, and statements of shareholders' equity. Manage fixed-asset project accounting Managing accounts for large funds-invested projects. Manage and account for fixed assets projects (capital projects), which required significant capital investments over many years. Perform capital planning and project approval Preparing a project finance report to solicit approvals in capital projects. Prepare budgets for projects that require heavy investments. Report on project finances to solicit approvals from management. Perform capital project accounting Accounting for large-scale and large-cost investments. Manage and account for ongoing activities related to capital projects, including setting up new projects, recording project transactions, monitoring and tracking spending, closing and capitalizing projects, and measuring the financial returns on completed projects. Process payroll Handling reporting time, managing pay, and processing taxes from salaries. Pay employees. Withhold taxes. Confirm the correct funds are paid to the correct government agency. Report time Recording the reporting time of employees on-site. Track working days, salary calculations, holidays taken, number of hours spend in the office, billing hours, etc. Manage pay Managing the total payments made in employees payroll, including bonuses and compensation. Manage and process payroll taxes Deducting and paying taxes from employees' salaries. Process accounts payable and expense reimbursements Handling bills and reimbursements to be made. Make payments for goods or services taken or used on behalf of the organization. Process accounts payable (AP) Processing payments of operating expenses and other supplier charges. This includes the development of policies and procedures around processing of accounts payable and all operations. This process is often supported by key technology enablers. Process expense reimbursements Processing reimbursements to employees for the expenses incurred during the course of business. Approve and process advancements and reimbursements for employee expenses on the organization's behalf. Capture and report relevant tax data and manage personal accounts. Manage corporate credit cards Handling and authoring credit cards to business entities or for corporate purchases. Manage treasury operations Managing business's investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Manage the financial assets and holdings of the organization. Optimize the organization's liquidity. Invest excess cash. Reduce financial risks. Manage treasury policies and procedures Managing rules and regulations for investments in trading in bonds, currencies, financial derivatives, etc. Establish policies and procedures for investments made. Optimize liquidity in treasury operations. Manage cash Taking care of all cash-related activities in the business. Manage and reconcile cash positions. Manage cash equivalents. Process and oversee electronic fund transfers. Develop cash flow forecasts. Manage cash flows. Produce cash management accounting transactions and reports. Manage and oversee banking relationships. Analyze, negotiate, resolve, and confirm bank fees. Manage in-house bank accounts Managing financial services provided by an in-house bank structure in the corporation that is operating like a commercial bank. Manage debt and investment Taking care of the organization's financial position. Manage its loans or debts from different sources and investments. Leverage the most profitable options to balance the financial position in the market. Monitor and execute risk and hedging transactions Performing transactions that limit investment risk with the help of derivatives, such as options and futures contracts. Manage interest rates, foreign exchange, and exposure risks. Develop and execute hedging transactions. Evaluate and refine hedging positions. Produce hedge accounting transactions and reports. Monitor credit. Manage financial fraud/dispute cases Handling cases that involve financial fraud. Resolve disputes. Manage internal controls Administering internal controls. work_functions.name: Acquire, Construct, and Manage Assets
work_functions.description: Relating to the design, construction, acquisition, and management of both productive and non-productive assets.

sub_work_functions.name: Plan and acquire assets
sub_work_functions.description: Planning, acquiring, and managing facilities, workspaces, and supporting assets. Acquire, configure, and manage facilities and workspaces, to include supporting equipment and materials.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop property strategy and long term vision
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Strategizing a long-term vision for managing properties. Prepare strategies and a long-term vision for managing purchased/retained properties.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan facility
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Recognizing the needs of facility users in order to construct a project proposal that meets those needs.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Provide workspace and facilities
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing the provision of the workspace and its assets. Arrange an office space with all assets (tables, chairs, computers, admin staff, etc.) according to requirements.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage facilities operations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing all operational activities of the facility. Manage how each function/business unit works. Support the manufacturing facility to attain organizational goals.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Plan and acquire assets Planning, acquiring, and managing facilities, workspaces, and supporting assets. Acquire, configure, and manage facilities and workspaces, to include supporting equipment and materials. Develop property strategy and long term vision Strategizing a long-term vision for managing properties. Prepare strategies and a long-term vision for managing purchased/retained properties. Plan facility Recognizing the needs of facility users in order to construct a project proposal that meets those needs. Provide workspace and facilities Managing the provision of the workspace and its assets. Arrange an office space with all assets (tables, chairs, computers, admin staff, etc.) according to requirements. Manage facilities operations Managing all operational activities of the facility. Manage how each function/business unit works. Support the manufacturing facility to attain organizational goals.

sub_work_functions.name: Design and construct assets
sub_work_functions.description: Designing and constructing assets such as machines, tools, factories, etc. Manage steps to acquire assets including managing capital, as well as planning, scheduling, and overseeing acquisition/construction.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage capital program for assets
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Producing and maintaining a planning schedule and a financial plan to purchase or manufacture productive assets. Determine the investment plan, monitor capital, and secure the necessary financing in order to realize completion of the program.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Design and plan asset construction
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Outlining the steps and strategies needed to construct assets. Verify that all regulations are adhered to and that all permissions have been granted. Organize and plan for resources to complete construction.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Schedule and perform construction work
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Arranging a timetable for which to perform construction work. Schedule resources to contract assets for new or replacement assets. Reschedule or redesign assets if needed.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage asset construction
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Overseeing the performance and quality of work. Assure that records are maintained throughout the construction process. Adhere to all safety, security, and access regulations set forth by the organization and all government standards.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Design and construct assets Designing and constructing assets such as machines, tools, factories, etc. Manage steps to acquire assets including managing capital, as well as planning, scheduling, and overseeing acquisition/construction. Manage capital program for assets Producing and maintaining a planning schedule and a financial plan to purchase or manufacture productive assets. Determine the investment plan, monitor capital, and secure the necessary financing in order to realize completion of the program. Design and plan asset construction Outlining the steps and strategies needed to construct assets. Verify that all regulations are adhered to and that all permissions have been granted. Organize and plan for resources to complete construction. Schedule and perform construction work Arranging a timetable for which to perform construction work. Schedule resources to contract assets for new or replacement assets. Reschedule or redesign assets if needed. Manage asset construction Overseeing the performance and quality of work. Assure that records are maintained throughout the construction process. Adhere to all safety, security, and access regulations set forth by the organization and all government standards.

sub_work_functions.name: Maintain assets
sub_work_functions.description: Preserving productive assets through the planning, managing, and performance of preventative, routine, and critical maintenance work.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan asset maintenance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Ensuring that necessary resources are available and tasks are prioritized accordingly through planning. Provide strategies and policies that identify tasks that need to be completed, and the resources necessary to fulfill those tasks.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage asset maintenance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Ensuring that asset maintenance is conducted in a timely manner and successfully. Schedule work with the required resources with an eye on quality control and safety. Verify that contracted maintenance meets performance targets.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform asset maintenance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Engaging in all aspects of asset maintenance. Ensure that all assets are functioning properly and to all specified codes and regulations where applicable. Maintenance includes all preventative, routine, and corrective activates.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Maintain assets Preserving productive assets through the planning, managing, and performance of preventative, routine, and critical maintenance work. Plan asset maintenance Ensuring that necessary resources are available and tasks are prioritized accordingly through planning. Provide strategies and policies that identify tasks that need to be completed, and the resources necessary to fulfill those tasks. Manage asset maintenance Ensuring that asset maintenance is conducted in a timely manner and successfully. Schedule work with the required resources with an eye on quality control and safety. Verify that contracted maintenance meets performance targets. Perform asset maintenance Engaging in all aspects of asset maintenance. Ensure that all assets are functioning properly and to all specified codes and regulations where applicable. Maintenance includes all preventative, routine, and corrective activates.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage asset end-of-life
sub_work_functions.description: Managing the disposition of assets at their end-of-life. End-of-life for an asset may be due to obsolescence, replacement, excess capacity, or disrepair among other potential factors. Steps may include decommissioning, disassembly, recycling, etc. Tracking and reporting may also be appropriate for some or all asset types due to law, regulation, or social/environmental responsibility.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop exit strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating a strategy for managing asset exits.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Decommission productive assets
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Retiring assets that are no longer viable to the business. Decommission assets that are no longer in working order, are out of date, or whose maintenance exceeds the cost of replacement.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform sale or trade
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Performing the sale of assets. Achieve and complete the sale process. Deliver the end product to the customers.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage take-back centers
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing locations where end-of-life assets are evaluated for decommissioning, disassembly, recycling, etc.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Dismantle assets
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Dismantling an asset into manageable parts. The parts may follow different dispositions, such as resale, reuse, recycle, etc.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Track parts
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Tracking the disposition of all parts from end-of-life assets. Tracking should provide an audit trail to include source, rational for disposition, and destination.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Recycle parts
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Recycling parts in accordance with legal, regulatory, and social/environmental responsibilities.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Ship hazardous material
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Planning, conducting, and tracking shipment of hazardous materials.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Provide government reporting
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Preparing and distributing government reports.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform abandonment
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Planning and performing abandonment activities. Whether facilities or equipment, ensure assets to be abandoned are safe, secure, and meet all legal, regulatory, and social/environmental responsibilities.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform waste and hazardous goods management
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Planning and performing waste and hazardous goods management. In compliance with all legal, regulatory, and social/environmental requirements, plan, document, and conduct hazardous material handling, disposal, and reporting.

In compliance with all legal, regulatory, and social/environmental requirements, plan, document, and conduct hazardous material handling, disposal, and reporting.

work_functions.name: Manage Enterprise Risk, Compliance, Remediation, and Resiliency
work_functions.description: Ensuring that an organization effectively manages its risk. Process groups are aligned with traditional risk management activities.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage enterprise risk
sub_work_functions.description: Creating requisite frameworks and coordinating all risk management activities for the entire organization and each function. Manage the enterprise risk by outlining the risk policies and procedures. Monitor and communicate all risk management activities. Encourage correspondence among the business units. Manage the risk of all business units and functions.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Establish the enterprise risk framework and policies
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating an agenda for the rules and regulations of enterprise risk that deal with hazardous, financial, operational, and strategic risks.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Oversee and coordinate enterprise risk management activities
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Coordinating to plan, organize, lead, and control the activities of an organization in order to minimize the special effects of risk on capital and earnings.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage business unit and function risk
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Analyzing the threats a business unit/function faces to prioritize the controls it implements..

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage enterprise risk Creating requisite frameworks and coordinating all risk management activities for the entire organization and each function. Manage business unit and function risk Analyzing the threats a business unit/function faces to prioritize the controls it implements..

sub_work_functions.name: Manage compliance
sub_work_functions.description: Managing steps to confirm enduring compliance to industry regulations and government legislation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Establish compliance framework and policies
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing a set of procedures detailing an organization's progress in complying with established guidelines, provisions, and legislation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage regulatory compliance
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Obeying laws, guidelines, strategies, and stipulations related to the business.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage compliance Managing steps to confirm enduring compliance to industry regulations and government legislation. Establish compliance framework and policies Developing a set of procedures detailing an organization's progress in complying with established guidelines, provisions, and legislation. Manage regulatory compliance Obeying laws, guidelines, strategies, and stipulations related to the business.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage remediation efforts
sub_work_functions.description: Administering the efforts and activities for remediation. This process element requires the organization to create plans for corrective action in collaboration with government agencies and pertinent professional services agencies which specialize in remediation efforts relevant to the organization's operations. Additionally, the organization needs to consult experts to validate the plan, determine resources allocation, resolve any legal concerns, and formulate a company-wide policy for remediation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Create remediation plans
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating plans for remediation efforts. Make a plan to address a case of environmental adulteration. Identify and treat the adulteration so that the area will become operational again.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Contact and confer with experts
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Discussing and soliciting advice from experts for in order to incorporate their suggestion (regarding Create remediation plans [11201]).

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Identify/dedicate resources
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Identifying and dedicating the resources for managing remediation efforts. Discern the resources needed for remediation efforts. Dispense with resources in a sound and well-reasoned manner.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Investigate legal aspects
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Examining regulatory and legislative frameworks. Obligate the organization to remediate any damages through compensations, fines, and any other remedial efforts necessitated to correct the situations. Analyze local environmental laws, binding international covenants, etc. in order to examine legal accuracy about the rules and procedures.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Investigate damage cause
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Studying the causes of damage, which could be environmental, physical, social, etc. at country level in order to institute better policies and regulations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Amend or create policy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Crafting a new framework of policies and procedures for deploying remediation efforts, or change existing policies and procedures. Adapt the policy structure to the context of the apposite national and international regulatory frameworks.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage business resiliency
sub_work_functions.description: Including the processes required to rapidly adapt and respond to any internal or external opportunity, demand, disruption, or threat. Develop a more dynamic, strategic, and integrated approach to managing compliance obligations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Develop the business resilience strategy
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating a strategy for rapidly adapting to disturbances. Maintain continuous business processes and protecting employees, assets, and overall brand equity.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Perform continuous business operations planning
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Developing plans to ensure continuous business operations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Test continuous business operations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Assessing ongoing activities within the organization that are not intended to stop except for in an emergency.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Maintain continuous business operations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Evaluating business operations. Determine which activities generate revenues, perform best, and provide good returns.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Share knowledge of specific risks across other parts of the organization
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Sharing information about risks and resilience strategies of business operations across the organization so that prospective risks can be avoided.

work_functions.name: Manage External Relationships
work_functions.description: Fostering external relationships with stakeholders of the entity, including investors, government and industry, the board of directors, and the general public. This is not related to customer management.

sub_work_functions.name: Build investor relationships
sub_work_functions.description: Creating a strategic management responsibility for integrating finance, communication, marketing, and securities law compliance. Allow the most effective two-way communication among the organization, the financial community, and other constituencies. Enlist the investor relations function to provide market intelligence to corporate management.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan, build, and manage lender relations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Building and managing relations with bankers or lenders through strong products/services strategies that bankers would want to invest in. Foster a receptive environment for low rates of interest, easy access to loans, etc.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Plan, build, and manage analyst relations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Creating and maintaining long-term relations with analysts. Involve analysts in strategy and product decisions in order to elicit valuable information.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Communicate with shareholders
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Practicing regular, transparent communication with shareholders through annual shareholders' meetings, quarterly earnings calls, shareholders letters, one-on-one emails or calls, etc.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Build investor relationships Creating a strategic management responsibility for integrating finance, communication, marketing, and securities law compliance. Involve analysts in strategy and product decisions in order to elicit valuable information. Communicate with shareholders Practicing regular, transparent communication with shareholders through annual shareholders' meetings, quarterly earnings calls, shareholders letters, one-on-one emails or calls, etc.

sub_work_functions.name: Manage government and industry relationships
sub_work_functions.description: Creating and maintaining relationships with government and industry representatives.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage government relations
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Persuading public and government policy at the local, regional, national, and global level (subject to government regulations).

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage relations with quasi-government bodies
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing relations with quasi-governmental organizations, corporations, businesses, or any other agency that is treated by national laws and principles to be under the supervision of the government but also distinct and self-directed from the government.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage relations with trade or industry groups
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing relations with organizations established and financed by businesses that operate in a specific industry. Participate in public relations actions such as lobbying and publishing, advertising, education, and political donations.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Manage lobby activities
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Managing lobbying activities to affect government policies.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage government and industry relationships Creating and maintaining relationships with government and industry representatives. Manage government relations Persuading public and government policy at the local, regional, national, and global level (subject to government regulations). sub_work_functions.name: Manage relations with board of directors
sub_work_functions.description: Maintaining relations with representatives of the stockholders. Establish corporate management-related policies and to make decisions on major company issues. Implement practices designed to engender communication, trust, and cooperation.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Report financial results
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Reporting financial results to management, and releasing results to the public. Report financial statements, including the income statement, balance sheet, and statement of cash flows.

sub_sub_work_functions.name: Report audit findings
sub_sub_work_functions.description: Reporting audit findings to management. Practice an internal audit with criteria for confirming a problem, a description of the situation, and the root cause of the problem. Make recommendations that resolve the issue.

sub_work_functions.search_text: Manage relations with board of directors Maintaining relations with representatives of the stockholders.
